Flavor Text: Small, Frail, Weak, and feels every ounce of pain,\nbut with sacrifice comes value.
A silly little rabbit running around in the grass\ngive it a boop on the nose for me would you?
A slippery critter, it likes to swim around in water\nhowever its not very threatening, just keep an eye on it.
A pesky mole, always trying to get in the way, if you ever\nneed to get rid of one grab a sledgehammer and whack it in the head.
A prickly vermin, be careful around its quills\nthey sting when they pierce your skin.
Thats quite a....strong smell its best to keep\n*cough* away from it *cough* for a while...
Where you find one it is more than likely\ntheres another close behind it.
What a cute bear, but beware its a hostile one\nit loves eating fish as well as killing other prey.
A little fawm, they love to frollock amoung the\ntall grass! Be aware it ages fast.
The mighty elk, it loves to trot around occasionally or\nif there's a predator it will run.
A silly little stoat, they love to run around all day\nand they are super cute, plus they get into fights!
A cute little gatherer, it digs in your trash\nfor food and scraps for itself and friends.
The lowly pronghorn grazes the field for its prey\nif it finds them it rams into their skulls with its head.
A pest in every way possible but they are just as\neasy to get rid of, if you have the supplies.
A horribly smart bird, it smells corpses to find its\nfood than signals other birds to the corpse.
An egg from a clever bird, even threatening\nin this state, soon it will become a blight of a bird.
This bird gets fish for its young with its sharp\ntalons and swift movement.
What a bull, rampaging through the woods\nwithout a single care in the world, watch out or else!
It is a small critter that you can find in forests\nbut be careful its claws can really really hurt.
With a huge shell on its back comes a huge\ndefense to get through, be careful, they also bite!
A little frog on its back is a note that reads:\nkick me for 10 foils!
A cute little tadpole it swims at its infancy until\nit grows old and gains arms and legs to walk.
It watches and sees everything and especially keeps an\neye out for creatures that are above them.
This creature is a flying version of a worker ant\nit likes to fly its way around.
This creature lurks in caves and tricks wild beasts\ninto thinking that it is food, but instead find it.
An evasive octopus, it loves to hide in the dark but\nwhen it is found, it will spray ink at the enemy.
Ah what a useless specimen, the only way it wants\nto get anything done is if it has company.
It keeps a watchful eye out for its prey, if it sees\nan enemy, it will take its eggs and bash them.
An ambitious young pup, mind you it is a feisty one,\nand as soon as it grows up your in for a treat!
A proud and vicious predator, in packs or by lonesome\nit will rend its prey.
A swift bird of its calibar, it swims to avoid its\npredators and flys to avoid its prey.
The meek and feeble sparrow, it gathers insects to\nfeed its offspring, and also to eat for themselves.
The royal mother of all ants alike, if you see it\nkill it at first sight or there will be ants of plenty.
It can smell a drop of blood from miles away,\nonce it does it will come to its prey immediately.
A surprisingly strong fish, with the power\nof attacking its prey then quickly slipping away.
An odd amount of squirrels curled up in a ball,\nshedding a few out as it moves around.
From under the brush comes its venomous bite,\neven a simple bite will kill.
What may be a measly worker ant right now,\ncan become an overwhelming force of ant's quickly.
A nearly defenseless mule, with a gift attached.\nThe attached note reads 'A gift from the Prospector, use wisely.'
Royalty doomed from the start, too many rats\nto rule over henseforth it is crumbling, and dying.
What a cute kitty but beware, it only has\nnine lives once there up, game over!
A truly worthy sacrifice, the black goat is one of\nthe greatest honor you can grant for sacrifice.
If its nice you will get treasure,\nhowever, if you're not nice, it will give you scrap.
Be careful, for if you call him cute he will\nbite a hole straight through your leg.
"Hey its me!! Nice Topdeck!! Am I your goto??\nIf so have yourself another Battery!!"
"It is time my dear insect friends, time to scavenge\nfor some bones that is! NOW DIG!!"
"A vacuous landscape fills my vision, illustrious and\nvariegated shall it be once more!"
"God F*$%ing Dammit, Drow Knight!!! Why am I always\ndragged here with you?!?!"
"Golly! So many new faces to see around here!! I excite!!"
Ah what a lovely hole in the ground I wonder wha-\noh thats what happens a million fluffy fellas biting me
The egg of a bird, smashed into pieces, sadly not\neverything may get the chance they deserve.
Be careful around this nest, many creatures lie within,\nready to sting you at any moment!
